title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9003.18 - Loitering
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9003.18 - Loitering

State Regulations

It is prohibited for any person to engage in loitering for
illegal purposes in any park. Any person in any park, including any park
street, shall be guilty of loitering who: (a) loiters or remains in a park for the
purpose of engaging, or soliciting another person to engage in sexual activity; or
(b) loiters or remains in any
park with one or more persons for the purpose of unlawfully using, possessing, distributing, selling or soliciting marijuana or a controlled substance, as
defined in section 220.00 of the New York State Penal Law. Notes

York State Register July 8, 2015/Volume XXXVII, Issue 27, eff. 7/8/2015

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
